data.title: 1 dead after altercation leads to shooting at Fort Worth apartment complex, officials say
data.meta_description: Fort Worth police are investigating a deadly shooting at an apartment complex as a homicide.
data.text:
A man was killed early Monday in a shooting at an east Fort Worth apartment complex, according to police.

Officers responded shortly after midnight to the Tides at 5400 apartments in the 5400 block of Boca Raton Boulevard, near Woodhaven Boulevard, after receiving 911 calls about shots fired.

Advertisement

They found one injured man at the scene. He was taken to a hospital, where he died.

Advertisement

He was identified as 21-year-old Kyron Sanders, according to Tarrant County medical examiner records.

Multiple shots were heard after a man screamed he had a gun and threatened to shoot, according to notes written in a preliminary police report.

Detectives determined the victim and several others were involved in an altercation that led to a shooting inside an apartment, police officials said in a news release.

Advertisement

The suspected shooter left the scene before the officers arrived, and no arrest has been announced, according to the release.

The investigation is ongoing.

Advertisement
